概率，可能性
偶然，运气

[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 钱斯绰号，赌徒，来源于盎格鲁诺曼底法语，含义是“好运”(good fortune)
Complete Help and Assistance Necessary for College Education 学院教育的全部帮助和援助需要

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"机会"之意。
means: chance ： 侧重指偶然或意外的机会，有时也指正常或好的机会。
opportunity ： 侧重指有利或适合于采取行动，以达到某一目的或实现某种愿望的最佳时机或机会。
occasion ： 指特殊时机或良机，也指时节。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些词语都可表示"发生"之意。
means: happen ： 普通用词，泛指一切客观事物或情况的发生，强调动作的偶然性。
occur ： 较正式用词，可指意外地发生，也可指意料中的发生。
chance ： 侧重事前无安排或无准备而发生的事，特指巧合。
take place ： 多指通过人为安排的发生。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"敢于冒险"之意。
means: venture ： 指冒风险试一试，或指有礼貌的反抗或反对。
chance ： 指碰运气、冒风险试试。
dare ： 可与venture换用，但语气较强，着重挑战或违抗。
hazard ： 主要指冒险作出某个选择，隐含碰运气意味。
risk ： 指不顾个人安危去干某事，侧重主动承担风险。

sentence.Network_en: They had met by chance at university and finished up getting married.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们在大学偶遇，最后结了婚。

sentence.Network_en: If cancers are spotted early there'sa high chance of survival.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果癌症在早期发现的话，存活的几率会很高。

sentence.Network_en: He did not get a chance to deepen his knowledge of Poland.
sentence.Network_cn: 他没有机会更深入地了解波兰。

jx.jx_en_mean: To find or meet accidentally; happen upon
jx.jx_cn_mean: 偶然找到，偶然遇到；偶然碰到

lj.lj_ly: While in Paris we chanced on two old friends.
lj.lj_ls: 在巴黎我们偶然碰到两位老朋友

jx.jx_en_mean: possibly (used in tentative enquiries or suggestions)
jx.jx_cn_mean: 万一，也许（用于试探性的询问或提议）

lj.lj_ly: were you looking for me by any chance?.

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)undertake something although it may be dangerous or unsuccessful

phrase.cizu_name: chance would be a fine thing

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)expressing a speaker's belief that something is desirable but the opportunity is unlikely to arise
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)成功固然好，只惜良机少

jx.jx_en_mean: [usu. with negative]have a prospect of success or survival

lj.lj_ly: his rivals don't stand a chance.
lj.lj_ls: 他的对手毫无成功的希望。

jx.jx_en_mean: behave in a way that leaves one vulnerable to danger or failure
do something risky with the hope of success

lj.lj_ly: They met by chance on a plane.
lj.lj_ls: 他们在飞机上不期而遇

lj.lj_ly: Is he, by chance, her brother?

jx.jx_en_mean: In the slight hope or possibility.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 万一发生：抱着微小的希望或可能性

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French cheance, from cheoir 'fall, befall', based on Latin cadere

entry.def: If there is a chance of something happening, it is possible that it will happen.

example.ex: Do you think they have a chance of beating Australia?...
example.tran: 你认为他们有可能击败澳大利亚吗？

example.ex: This partnership has a good chance of success...
example.tran: 这个组合获胜的希望很大。

entry.def: If you have a chance to do something, you have the opportunity to do it.

example.ex: The electoral council announced that all eligible people would get a chance to vote...
example.tran: 选举委员会宣布，所有有资格者都将获得投票的机会。

example.ex: Most refugee doctors never get the chance to practice medicine in British hospitals...
example.tran: 多数去避难的医生永远没有机会在英国医院行医。

entry.def: A chance meeting or event is one that is not planned or expected.
If you chance to do something or chance on something, you do it or find it although you had not planned or tried to.

example.ex: A man I chanced to meet proved to be a most unusual character...
example.tran: 我邂逅了一个人，后来发现他是个极为与众不同的家伙。

example.ex: It was just then that I chanced to look round.
example.tran: 就在那时，我恰好环顾了下四周。

entry.def: If you chance something, you do it even though there is a risk that you may not succeed or that something bad may happen.

example.ex: Andy knew the risks. I cannot believe he would have chanced it...
example.tran: 安迪知道有风险，我不敢相信他竟然甘冒其险。

example.ex: He decided no assassin would chance a shot from amongst that crowd.
example.tran: 他认定，没有刺客会冒险混在人群里开枪。

entry.def: Something that happens by chance was not planned by anyone.

example.ex: He had met Mr Maude by chance.

entry.tran: (用以询问某事是否属实)会不会，可能
entry.def: You can use by any chance when you are asking questions in order to find out whether something that you think might be true is actually true.

example.ex: Are they by any chance related?

entry.def: If you say that someone stands a chance of achieving something, you mean that they are likely to achieve it. If you say that someone doesn't stand a chance of achieving something, you mean that they cannot possibly achieve it.

example.ex: Being very good at science subjects, I stood a good chance of gaining high grades...
example.tran: 我理科很棒，所以很有机会拿高分。

example.ex: Neither is seen as standing any chance of snatching the leadership from him.
example.tran: 两人都不被认为有任何可能从他手中夺得领导权。

entry.def: When you take a chance, you try to do something although there is a large risk of danger or failure.

example.ex: You take a chance on the weather if you holiday in the UK...
example.tran: 在英国度假，只有赌天气了。

example.ex: From then on, they were taking no chances...
example.tran: 从那时起，他们就不再冒险了。

means.word_mean: 1. a possibility due to a favorable combination of circumstances;

sentences.sentence: "the holiday gave us the opportunity to visit Washington"

means.word_mean: 2. an unknown and unpredictable phenomenon that causes an event to result one way rather than another;

sentences.sentence: "we ran into each other by pure chance"
"you take a chance when you let her drive"

means.word_mean: 4. a measure of how likely it is that some event will occur;

sentences.sentence: "we have a good chance of winning"
"I chanced to meet my old friend in the street"

means.word_mean: 2. take a risk in the hope of a favorable outcome;

sentences.sentence: "When you buy these stocks you are gambling"

means.word_mean: 3. come upon, as if by accident; meet with;

sentences.sentence: "I happened upon the most wonderful bakery not very far from here"
"She chanced upon an interesting book in the bookstore the other day"

means.word_mean: 1. occurring or appearing or singled out by chance;

sentences.sentence: "their accidental meeting led to a renewal of their friendship"

list.explanation: (常用于否定句)毫无希望,绝无可能

example.en: I don't have a snowball's chance in hell，but I'll try anyway.
example.zh: 虽然我明知没有什么希望，但无论如何我还要试一试。

example.en: We took a chance with weather when we were going on a walking tour.
example.zh: 我们在去徒步旅行时是怀着侥幸心理的，希望天气可能会好。

Finally, I've got the chance to put on my new suit tonight.
If I had first met Joe as a freshman in high school we wouldn't even have had the chance to get to know each other
Do you by any chance have a car available?
Third, give learners the chance to compare and contrast good and bad solutions to the problems.
To create chances for the poor.

jushi.english: There's a chance that I will see her.
A good knowledge of English will improve their chances of employment.
jushi.chinese: 英语好将有助于增加他们的就业机会。

jushi.english: He gave me no chance to reply.
jushi.chinese: 他没有给我回答的机会。
